caption.p: a) Background subtracted voltammogram showing two oxidation peaks due to 1 μM dopamine plus 1 μM adenosine, along with the corresponding curvature boundaries for each peak: 0.33 V and 0.79 V for DA, and 1.31 V and 1.5 V for ADO. b) Background subtracted voltammogram showing two oxidation peaks due to 0.5 μM epinephrine, and the corresponding curvature boundaries for each peak: 0.38 V and 0.80 V for first peak, and 1.25 V and 1.5 V for the second. Vertical dashed lines indicate the switching potentials.
